metadata.title: Lines and Angles for Kids
metadata.description: Interactive questions to build understanding of basic geometry concepts
metadata.author: Math Educator

questions.question: Which line is the angle bisector?
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 200 200'><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='50' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='150' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='100' y2='20' stroke='red' stroke-width='2' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/><line x1='100' y1='100' x2='150' y2='150' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.explanation: The red dashed line perfectly splits the angle into two equal parts.

questions.question: Line OB is angle bisector of AOC. If L AOC is 80°, then LAOB
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 130 130'><style>.line { stroke: black; stroke-width: 1.5; fill: none; }.line-blue { stroke: blue; stroke-width: 1.5; fill: none; }.point { font-family: Arial; font-size: 10px; font-weight: bold; }.angle-fill { fill: rgba(100,200,255,0.3); stroke: none; }.point-marker { fill: red; r: 2; }.angle-label { font-size: 10px; }</style><path class='angle-fill' d='M 10 110 L 90 110 L 79.28 70 Z'/><path class='angle-fill' d='M 10 110 L 79.28 70 L 50 40.72 Z'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='90' y2='110' class='line'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='79.28' y2='70' class='line-blue'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='50' y2='40.72' class='line'/><circle cx='10' cy='110' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='05' y='120' class='point'>O</text><circle cx='90' cy='110' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='93' y='113' class='point'>C</text><circle cx='79.28' cy='70' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='82.28' y='73' class='point'>B</text><circle cx='50' cy='40.72' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='53' y='43.72' class='point'>A</text><text x='100' y='65' class='angle-label'>80°</text></svg>

questions.question: OB is angle bisector, Angle AOB is =
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 130 130'><style>.line { stroke: black; stroke-width: 1.5; fill: none; }.line-blue { stroke: blue; stroke-width: 1.5; fill: none; }.point { font-family: Arial; font-size: 10px; font-weight: bold; }.angle-fill { fill: rgba(100,200,255,0.3); stroke: none; }.point-marker { fill: red; r: 2; }.angle-label { font-size: 10px; }</style><path class='angle-fill' d='M 10 110 L 90 110 L 79.28 70 Z'/><path class='angle-fill' d='M 10 110 L 79.28 70 L 50 40.72 Z'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='90' y2='110' class='line'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='79.28' y2='70' class='line-blue'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='50' y2='40.72' class='line'/><circle cx='10' cy='110' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='05' y='120' class='point'>O</text><circle cx='90' cy='110' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='93' y='113' class='point'>C</text><circle cx='79.28' cy='70' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='82.28' y='73' class='point'>B</text><circle cx='50' cy='40.72' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='53' y='43.72' class='point'>A</text><text x='50' y='100' class='angle-label'>30°</text></svg>
questions.explanation: The red dashed line perfectly splits the angle into two equal parts.

questions.question: OB is angle bisector, Angle AOC is =
questions.svg_content: <svg xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 130 130'><style>.line { stroke: black; stroke-width: 1.5; fill: none; }.line-blue { stroke: blue; stroke-width: 1.5; fill: none; }.point { font-family: Arial; font-size: 10px; font-weight: bold; }.angle-fill { fill: rgba(100,200,255,0.3); stroke: none; }.point-marker { fill: red; r: 2; }.angle-label { font-size: 10px; }</style><path class='angle-fill' d='M 10 110 L 90 110 L 79.28 70 Z'/><path class='angle-fill' d='M 10 110 L 79.28 70 L 50 40.72 Z'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='90' y2='110' class='line'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='79.28' y2='70' class='line-blue'/><line x1='10' y1='110' x2='50' y2='40.72' class='line'/><circle cx='10' cy='110' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='05' y='120' class='point'>O</text><circle cx='90' cy='110' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='93' y='113' class='point'>C</text><circle cx='79.28' cy='70' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='82.28' y='73' class='point'>B</text><circle cx='50' cy='40.72' r='2' class='point-marker'/><text x='53' y='43.72' class='point'>A</text><text x='50' y='100' class='angle-label'>15°</text></svg>
questions.explanation: The red dashed line perfectly splits the angle into two equal parts.
